message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SY

This paper proposes a location-based packet forwarding mechanism for vehicular Named Data Networking (NDN). The paper focuses on the challenges of frequent connectivity disruptions and sudden network changes in a vehicle network. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses security issues related to vehicular networks, which makes cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) another likely category. The paper proposes an algorithm to guide Interests towards data producers using a specialized shortest path over the road topology, which makes cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) a possible category. The paper also discusses an adaptive discovery and selection mechanism that can identify the best data source across multiple geographic areas, which makes cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) another possible category. Finally, the paper proposes a mechanism to bind NDN data names to the producers' geographic area(s), which makes cs.SY (Systems and Control) a possible category.
